ratings.question_text: Overall, how would you rate the workload of this course in comparison to other Yale courses you have taken:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
What is your overall rating of the primary instructor?
The primary instructor's sensitivity to students and ability to provide students with adequate feedback was:

narratives.question_text: Indicate the total number of hours per week (outside the classroom) you spent on this course:
comments: depends on if there was a vmoc or certificate due. anywhere from 4-8

narratives.question_text: Looking back on this course, what is your overall assessment of the course:  What are its strengths and weaknesses, and in what ways might it be improved?
comments: Excellent course. Very practicalStrengths: Instructors are excellent and on top of their fields. Certificates and table top exercises a plus. Enjoy the group work and the final project presentations.Weakness: Could use more practice with risk communication.
Always a fun class to sit and participate in.Well-organized. Knew what to expect for every class.Willing to listen to what the students thought of the course throughout the semester.
strengths:VMOCS and powerpoint briefs were very helpful with processing and applying all the new informationintimate/tight-nit groupuseful information&certificateslimitations:

narratives.question_text: Please evaluate the instructor of this course. What are the instructor's strengths and weaknesses, and in what ways might his or her teaching be improved?
comments: Instructor: Sandy Bogucki  Dr. Sandy Bogucki:Excellent Instructor, practical, great lecturer, and down to earth. Provides feedback appropriately.Lt. Col. McGovern:Irreplaceable. Amazing experiences. Always willing to meet with students. Goes above and beyond.
Instructor: Sandy Bogucki  Provided great facilitation and feedback in class discussions.
Instructor: Sandy Bogucki  strengthsProfessors&TA very enthusiastic about topicEach professor has a very unique specialty and and clearly very knowledgeable in their area

narratives.question_text: If this course included instruction by a teaching assistant (TA), please evaluate the TA here. What are the strengths and weaknesses and how might their teaching be improved? (Specify name of the TA).
comments: Kasey,keeps the class on track. Excellent TA.

Kasey Yao Fu provided great feedback when inquired to and was understanding of the student's situation. Always reminded students of the assignments that were to be done and provided external sources that were enriching to read and use for coursework.
Very good as serving as liaison between students&professorsOn top of emails and reminders

narratives.question_text: How would you summarize this course for a fellow student? Would you recommend it to another student? Why or why not?
comments: This is one of the courses that I spent the most time on this semester, but well worth it. While homework are long, they are useful and adds credentials to CV. Learn to manage emergencies, construct table top exercise, and also earn certificates from FEMA. Most practical course I have had in Yale so far. Able to put knowledge into practice. Would love to see emergency response/ESF 8 public health track in the public health school.
A course providing exposure to the topic of emergency planning for future health professionals; highly recommend!
